subject: Memorandum of Understanding between NHAI and IOCL - reg.
text: #Raly 74 TTHrf %ifetazrut (Ts; 9Rde7 &k rTHRf HATT4, TRG RraFT) National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways, Government of India) Fta T v-5 %i 6, Tarr-10, ERAT, 78 favvlt 110 075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka, New Delhi-110075 3r/Phone 91-11-25074100 25074200 NHAI/Policy Guidelines/ Access Permission/2022 Policy Circular No. 14.21/2022 dated 17th June, 2022 {Decision taken on E-Office File No. RO-Delhi/MoU (Computer No: 144028)} Sub.: Memorandum of Understanding between NHAI and IOCL- reg: Both NHAI & IOCL are engaged in construction, operation and maintenance of linear infrastructures like National Highway and Petroleum & Gas cross country pipelines, each proponent requiring permission to cross each other's infrastructure. It is worth to mention that both the companies are involved in creation Of national infrastructure which are contributing in a great way in economic development of the country. However, it has been felt that of permission involves many processes which takes long period at many times which lead to in project execution: 2 To resolve such issues and streamline the permission process to a fixed time period, a Memorandum %f Understanding (MoU) has been executed for addressing the issues of both sides: The said MOU is enclosed herewith for compliance. 3 This issues with the approval of Competent Authority. Encl: As above. 12 06 2) (Sanjay Kumar Patel) General Manager (Coord:) To: All Officers of NHAI HQ ROs/ PIUs/ CMUs/ Site Offices to: 1 Hindi Officer for translation in Hindi. 2. Library for hosting the circular on library site_ 3. Web Admin for circulation '4 W t NHAL grant delay Copy
